objects.name: Silent mode - using long press/power

steps.instruction: TBD

objects.description:
Disabled, this case is a duplicate of  TC#3534

"As a user, I want the phone menu to display the high-level phone actions (including Turn off Airplane Mode, Silence Incoming Calls, Power off) when I long-press the power button,
so I can easily control the phone's important states."

Prerequisites:  Phone is in state where Airplane Mode is off.
objects.name: Airplane mode - using long press/power

steps.expected: Phone menu is displayed with the following options:  "Turn On Airplane mode", "Silence Incoming calls", "Restart", "Power off".  There is also a "Cancel" button at the bottom.
steps.instruction: Long press the power button.

objects.description:
Prerequisites:
- Create a contact person with a valid phone number in the Contacts App
objects.name: [SMS] Sending SMS

steps.instruction: 1) on Homescreen launch Contacts App (Orange circle with a white person silhouette)
2) select a pre-existing contact person
3) Check if a phone number exists

steps.expected: In the Messaging App, the cursor is blinking in the textbox with a keyboard popped up
steps.instruction: 4) Tap the SMS out icon on the far right

steps.expected:
After hitting send, your message you typed will appear in the Message log
 Pull down the notification tray, and verify the same message appears in the notifications log
steps.instruction: Type in a message and hit "Send".

objects.name: [Settings] Verify default list

steps.expected:
#Network & Connectivity
- Airplane mode = unchecked
- GPS = checked
- Wifi = offline
.- Cellular & Data = <empty> 
- Cellular & Data = <name of service provider> (if SIM card installed)
- Bluetooth = Disabled
- Hotspot 

# Personalization
- Sound
- Brightness
- Wallpaper
- Language & Region
- Keyboard

# Security & Privacy
- Phone Lock

# Device
- About Phone
- Accessibility
- Storage
steps.instruction:
1. Launch the Setting App for the first time

2. Confirm the list of default settings and values

objects.description:
As a user I want to be visually notified when Airplane mode is enabled or disabled so I can understand the state of my phones connections.

Please see this issue: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1034455
objects.name: [Settings] Enabling / Disabling Airplane Mode

steps.instruction: Launch Settings App.

steps.expected: An airplane icon appears in the upper right hand corner of the status bar. If Wireless or Data connection icons were previously shown in the Status Bar, they should not appear if Airplane mode is enabled.
steps.instruction: Enable Airplane Mode.

steps.expected: The airplane icon should not be present in notification tray with Airplane mode off. Wifi and/or Data connection icons should appear in the notification tray again if they were previously enabled.
steps.instruction: Disable Airplane Mode.

steps.expected: Airplane mode is still functioning properly without issue.
steps.instruction: Repeat steps 2 and 3 at least 20 times

objects.description:
This case checks that the functionality of homescreen works when the phone is booted, and that you can unlock the device through the Lockscreen

#Pre-Requisite:
#-Have a Sim PIN set
#-Have Phonelock toggled ON
objects.name: [HOME SCREEN] Verify that the User can unlock the device and navigate the Homescreen

steps.expected: The device is booted to the Lockscreen
steps.instruction: Power on the device

steps.expected: The device is unlocked and the Sim PIN disable prompt is given.
steps.instruction: On the Lockscreen, Slide to the right to unlock th phone.

steps.expected: Homescreen is launched and SIM is detected.
steps.instruction: Enter in SIM PIN to unlock SIM.

steps.expected: It is possible to navigate between pages, and all homescreen app icons are displayed correctly
steps.instruction: Pan down on the homescreen.

steps.expected: It is possible to navigate between pages, and all homescreen app icons are displayed correctly
steps.instruction: Pan up on the homescreen.

objects.description: It should be possible to launch all P0 apps from Homescreen without crashing or hanging.
objects.name: [HOME SCREEN] Launch Apps from Homescreen

steps.expected: Dialer launches.
steps.instruction: Launch the homescreen.  Open the dialer app.

steps.expected: SMS app launches.
steps.instruction: Click home button.  Open the SMS app.

steps.expected: Browser app launches.
steps.instruction: Click home button.  Open the Browser app.

steps.expected: Contacts app launches.
steps.instruction: Click home button.  Open the Contacts app.

steps.expected: Settings app launches.
steps.instruction: Click home button.  Open the Settings app.

steps.expected: Camera app launches.
steps.instruction: Click the home button.  Open the Camera app.

steps.expected: Gallery app launches.
steps.instruction: Click the home button.  Open the Gallery app.

steps.expected: Marketplace app launches.
steps.instruction: Click the home button.  Open the Marketplace app.

objects.description: It should be possible to launch the dialer, make an outgoing call, and adjust the call volume while the call is active.
objects.name: [DIALER] Verify an outbound call can be made and that the Call Volume can be adjusted

steps.expected: Dialer launches
steps.instruction: From the Homescreen, Launch the Dialer App

steps.expected: The Number is displayed as entered in the number field of the dialer
steps.instruction: Dial a phone number including a Country and Area Code

steps.expected: Phone call is initiated and the call rings out to the number dialled
steps.instruction: Tap the "Dial" button

steps.expected: Verify that the Call Volume gets louder
steps.instruction: While the phone call is in progress, adjust the volume rocker up

steps.expected: Verify that the Call Volume gets quieter
steps.instruction: While the phone call is in progress, adjust the volume rocker down

objects.description: It should be possible to multitask on the phone; e.g. open a few different apps while a call is in progress.
objects.name: [DIALER] Open different apps during a call

steps.expected: The homescreen is invoked.
steps.instruction: Open the dialer and initiate a call (alternately, you can accept an incoming call).   Click the home button.

steps.expected: Camera app launches.  Phone call continues.
steps.instruction: With the call in session, click the home button and launch the Camera app.

steps.expected: Gallery app launches. Phone call continues.
steps.instruction: With the call in session, click the home button and launch the Gallery app.

steps.expected: Calendar app launches.  Phone call  continues.
steps.instruction: With the call in session, click the home button and launch the Calendar app.

objects.description:
Verify that when the device is Locked, it is able to receive a call, and that the vibration and sound from receiving a call functions correctly

#Pre-Requisite:
#-Have Ring Volume set above 50%
#-Have Vibrate and Ring Enabled
#-Have PhoneLock toggled ON
objects.name: [DIALER] Verify that the User can receive a call whilst the device is locked

steps.expected: The phone is locked and the screen is shut off
steps.instruction: From the Homescreen, Lock the device by pressing the power button
From a second device call the Locked device

steps.expected: Phone call should ring in to the locked device with vibration and sound
steps.instruction: The Locked device receives the call

objects.description:
It should be possible to receive a call, and if the phone is configured so, get vibration and ring tone, if the device is  unlocked.

Prerequisites:  The device is unlocked.
objects.name: [DIALER] Receive a call with vibration and sound (device unlocked)

steps.instruction: Go to Settings and Select Sound settings make sure volume is set at least half way.
Turn on "Vibrate" and "Ring" by enabling them.

steps.expected: It should be possible to receive a call with vibration and sound to the unlocked device.
steps.instruction: Call into the unlocked device

objects.description: It should be possible to activate/deactivate mute during a call.
objects.name: [DIALER]  Activate/Deactivate mute during a call

steps.instruction: Call the device from a separate line or device.

steps.expected: Audio from  call should not be audible on the second phone.
steps.instruction: Toggle the mute button (on call screen or call screen -> on keypad) on and speak.

steps.expected: Audio from the call should be audible on the second phone.
steps.instruction: Toggle the mute off (on call screen or call screen -> on keypad) and speak.

objects.description: If two or more calls are made to the same number, they should be bunched accordingly in the call log.
objects.name: [CALL LOG] Make two or more calls to the same number

steps.expected: In the call log, calls to the same number are bunched together with" (2)" following the number string.
steps.instruction: Using the B2G phone, make and terminate two subequent calls to the same number.

steps.expected: In the call log, calls to the same number are similarly bunched.  The correct number of calls to same number is shown in the parentheses following the number string.
steps.instruction: Make several more calls to the same number.

objects.description: When two or more calls are received from the same number, they should be bunched accordingly in the call log.
objects.name: [CALL LOG] Receive 2 or more calls from the same number

steps.expected: In the call log, calls from the same number are bunched together with" (2)" following the number string.
steps.instruction: Using another phone, make and terminate two subequent calls (into the B2G phone) from the same number.

steps.expected: In the call log, calls from the same number are similarly bunched.  The correct number of calls to same number is shown in the parentheses following the number string.
steps.instruction: Make several more calls from the same number.

objects.description: When two or more missed calls are received from the same number, they should be bunched accordingly in the call log.
objects.name: [CALL LOG] Receive 2 or more missed calls from the same number

steps.expected: In both the call log and missed call log, calls from the same number are bunched together with" (2)" following the number string.
steps.instruction: Using another phone, make and terminate two subequent calls (into the B2G phone) from the same number.  Terminate the calls before answering them on B2G phone.

objects.description:
Call log should show the correct contents of the tabs All and Missed.

Prerequisites:  
Have some missed/ ignored/ answered calls from both contacts and non-contacts(just phone numbers)
objects.name: [CALL LOG] Verify the contents of the tabs All and Missed display correctly.

steps.expected: DUT should receive a missed call notification.
steps.instruction: With another device create some missed calls to the DUT.

steps.expected: Dialer app is launched and Call log is displayed.
steps.instruction: Tap on Missed Call Notification.

steps.expected: "All"  should show all incoming calls, sorted by state.  Missed calls are also shown in a separate tab.
steps.instruction: Click "All"

steps.expected: "Missed" shows all missed calls.
steps.instruction: Click "Missed"

objects.description:
It should be possible to select and delete call logs.

Prerequisites:
Have a missed and answered call from a contact and a number.
objects.name: [CALL LOG] Select and delete a call log.

steps.instruction: Open the Dialer app.
Tap on Call Log icon.
Click the "Edit" icon (top right corner).

steps.expected: Calls associated with that number are deleted.  If it was a missed call, those related calls are deleted from "missed calls".
steps.instruction: Delete a missed Contact entry.

steps.expected: Calls associated with that number are deleted.  If it was a missed call, those related calls are deleted from "missed calls".
steps.instruction: Delete an answered Contact entry.

steps.expected: Calls associated with that number are deleted.  If it was a missed call, those related calls are deleted from "missed calls".
steps.instruction: Delect a missed number entry

steps.expected: Calls associated with that number are deleted.  If it was a missed call, those related calls are deleted from "missed calls".
steps.instruction: Delete an Answered entry.

objects.description: It should be possible to delete all call logs.
objects.name: [CALL LOG] Delete all call logs

objects.description:
It must be possible to create a contact by filling all contact fields. The data should be preserved.

Prerequisite:
Have some photos on the device.
objects.name: [CONTACTS] Verify the user can add a new contact. (filling all the fields)

steps.expected: The contacts app will open.
steps.instruction: Open the Contacts app.

steps.expected:
New "add contact" screen is displayed.

All fields are available and editable (e.g. appropriate keyboard pops up for the field, be it numeric or alphabetical).
steps.instruction: Tap "+" icon (top right).

steps.expected: A thumbnail of the Gallery image you selected and cropped appears in the box.
steps.instruction: Add a Picture from Gallery (select Gallery, and pick an image)
Add a first name.
Add a last name.
Add a Phone number.
Add an E-mail.
Add a Street address.
Add a Zip code.
Add a City.
Add a Country.
Add a Comment

steps.expected: After clicking done, all of the available field data is available when reaccessing the contact (include after phone restart or shutting the contacts app).
steps.instruction: Press the Done button in the top right.
Press the edit button in the top right.

steps.expected: A thumbnail of the image you took from Camera appears in the box
steps.instruction: Add a Picture from Camera app (select Camera, and take a picture)

objects.description:
It should be possible to edit an existing contact's name and phone number.

#Prerequisites:  
#-User has an Existing Contact created with all fields filled
objects.name: [CONTACTS] Verify an existing contact's name and phone number can be updated

steps.instruction: From the Homescreen, open the Contacts App

steps.expected: The contact's details are displayed
steps.instruction: Navigate to an existing contact with a saved Name and Phone Number.

steps.expected: The edit menu is displayed for that contact
steps.instruction: Tap the Edit button in the top right corner

steps.expected: Contact is saved with new name and all other data is preserved
steps.instruction: Change the name of the contact  then select the "Update" button in the top right corner
Close/Restart the Contacts App

steps.expected: The contact's details are displayed and the updated name for the contact still appears correct
steps.instruction: Navigate to the contact from step 2 and select the updated contact.
Tap the Edit button in the top right corner

steps.expected: Contact is saved with new phone number and all other data is preserved
steps.instruction: Change the phone number of the contact then select the "Update" button in the top right corner

steps.expected: The contact's details are displayed and the updated phone number for the contact still appears correct
steps.instruction: Close/Restart the Contacts App

objects.description:
It should be possible to pin a contact as a "favorite" and add to the favorite list.

Prerequisities:  Contacts app is launched.  More than one contact is available.
objects.name: [CONTACTS] Add contact to favorite list

steps.expected: Contact receives star once is has been added as favorite.  Button text switches to "remove as favorite".  In the Contacts list, there is not an additional "starred" category to which the contact has been added.
steps.instruction: Click the contact that you want to add to "favorites" list.  Without going to edit mode, clink the "Add as favorite" button.

objects.description:
It should be possible to delete a contact from the favourite list.

Prerequisites:  Contact app has been launched.   More than one contact is available, at least one has been added to favorites list.
objects.name: [CONTACTS] Delete a contact from the favourite list

steps.expected: Contact is removed from favorites list, but still exists in all other lists where it appeared before.
steps.instruction: Click the contact you want removed from the list.  Without going into edit mode, click "remove as favorite".

steps.expected: Contact is removed from favorites list.  Contact is also removed from all other lists where it appeared before.
steps.instruction: Add the contact back to the favorites list.  Now, go into edit mode and delete the contact.

objects.description:
It should be possible to send an SMS from a contact.

Prerequisites:  a contact exists  with a phone number.
objects.name: [CONTACTS] Send an sms from a contact detail

steps.expected: Contact launches.  There is a place to call (telephone icon next to number) and an sms button available.
steps.instruction: Select the contact to which you want to send an sms.

steps.expected: SMS application launches.  If there is already an existing thread in progress with the said number, this thread is launched, and populated with previous messages sent back and forth.  If not, an empty message thread is started.
steps.instruction: Hit the SMS button.

steps.expected: Message is sent, as typed to destination number and shows up there.  Message as typed also appears in the message thread.
steps.instruction: type in a message and hit "send".

objects.name: [CONTACTS] Performing a call from a contact detail

steps.expected: Contact app opens.
steps.instruction: Open the contact app.

steps.expected: Contact is opened.
steps.instruction: Select a contact.

steps.expected: Dialer is launched with contact number.  Call is established correctly to the contact number.
steps.instruction: Click phone number to dial the contact.

objects.description: It should be possible to access homescreen edit mode; it should be also possible to exit to normal homescreen mode.
objects.name: [HOME SCREEN] Access and exit from edit mode

steps.expected: Edit mode is opened.
steps.instruction: Long press an application icon on homescreen.

steps.expected: Edit mode is closed.
steps.instruction: Press home button.

objects.description:
It should be possible to move an application icon around on the homescreen.

Prerequisites:  
Homescreen is launched and viewable.
objects.name: [HOME SCREEN] Verify the user can move an application around on the homescreen.

steps.instruction: Swipe left once to view first screen with app icons.

steps.expected: Edit mode is launched (Icons appear to pulsate)
steps.instruction: Long tap (>3 seconds) on an app icon

steps.expected: The app icon is moved successfully.
steps.instruction: Hold the icon and move it one screen to the right.

steps.expected: The app icon is moved successfully.
steps.instruction: Hold the icon again and move it one screen to the left.

steps.expected: The app icon is moved successfully. An icons on the top row are moved to the left and down to make space for the app icon getting moved.
steps.instruction: Hold the icon again and move it to the top row.

steps.expected: The app icon is moved successfully. An icons are moved up to make space for the app icon getting moved.
steps.instruction: Hold the icon again and move it to the bottom row.

objects.description: It should be possible to delete an application.  The way to do it is to press "X" on the application's icon when in edit mode.
objects.name: [HOME SCREEN] Delete an application by pressing the button "X" from the edit mode

steps.expected: Edit mode is launched (app icons are vibrating).
steps.instruction: Press home button to go home if not already there.   Long tap (>3 seconds) an app icon to open edit mode.

steps.expected: App is deleted.
steps.instruction: Press "delete" button on an app icon (small X).

steps.expected: Edit mode is closed (no more vibrating icons).  Deleted app icon has been removed.
steps.instruction: Press home button.

objects.description:
It should be possible to send an SMS with multiple line breaks and word spaces.

Prerequisities:  SMS app is launched, destination phone number has been added already.
objects.name: [SMS] Send a text message by entering the phone number (insert line breaks and multiple  spaces between words)

steps.instruction: Write a text message with multiple line breaks and multiple spaces.

steps.expected: The SMS is sent and it shows correctly.
steps.instruction: Send the sms.

objects.description:
It should be possible to receive an SMS with vibration and sound when the device is unlocked.

Prerequisites:  Device is unlocked.  Dialer app is launched.  Settings for vibration and sound are default (enabled for incoming SMS).
objects.name: [SMS] Receive a SMS with vibration and sound (device unlocked)

steps.expected: The SMS is received with vibration and sound.  The proper incoming SMS notification is also received.
steps.instruction: Send an incoming SMS to device.

objects.description:
It should be possible to delete all conversations by pressing the "delete all" button.

Prerequisites: there are a few SMS threads sent in fro other phones. The SMS UI is launched.
objects.name: [SMS] Delete all conversations by pressing the "delete all" button

steps.expected: SMS conversation list goes into "Edit Mode".
steps.instruction: Click "Edit" icon in upper right corner.

steps.expected: All items are shown as checked.
steps.instruction: Click the "Select all"  button in lower right.

steps.expected: Prompt is given:  "Are you sure you want to delete these conversations?"
steps.instruction: Click "Delete".

steps.expected: All selected items are deleted. Items deleted are no longer viewable in Messages view. Messages pane is no longer in "Edit Mode."
steps.instruction: Click "OK".

objects.description:
It should be possible to take a picture using the device camera. The first time you use the camera you should receive a geolocation prompt.

Prerequisites:  
Phone has micro SD card with space to save pictures.
objects.name: [CAMERA] Verify the user can take several pictures with camera.

steps.expected: The camera app opens and you receive a geolocation prompt asking you if you want to share your location.
steps.instruction: Open the Camera App.

steps.expected: Picture is taken.  Picture is saved to gallery.  Camera returns control to "preview" view.
steps.instruction: Click the camera "shutter" button.

steps.expected: Photo is restored to large (full screen) view.
steps.instruction: Click the thumbnail for the photo just taken.

steps.expected: Pictures should be saved to gallery, and after each picture is taken camera should return to preview mode.
steps.instruction: Repeat step 1, taking a series of pictures in both portrait and landscape mode.

objects.description:
It should be possible to navigate the photos in the Grid View of the Gallery App. The user can then select and view individual thumbnails in Single Photo View.

#Prerequisites:   
#-Photos are available on the Media Storage
objects.name: [GALLERY] Verify the user can browse photos in the Gallery App

steps.expected: The Gallery is launched, then Grid View is properly displayed with all onscreen photo thumbnails fully loaded
steps.instruction: From the Homescreen, Open the Gallery App

steps.expected: The display scrolls down through the thumbnails in the Grid View
steps.instruction: Swipe up

steps.expected: Selected thumbnail is displayed in Single Photo View
steps.instruction: Select a thumbnail

steps.expected: The user is navigated back to the Grid View
steps.instruction: Click "back" icon (single photo view, its the arrow on the top left)

steps.expected: The display scrolls up through the thumbnails in the Grid View
steps.instruction: Swipe down

objects.description:
It should be possible to load a website via WiFi.  

Prerequisite:
Have WiFi turned on and connected to a network.
objects.name: [BROWSER] Verify the user can load a website via WiFi.

steps.expected: The browser app will open.
steps.instruction: Open the browser app.

steps.expected: The URL bar will be in focused.
steps.instruction: Tap on the URL bar.

steps.expected: The correct website will be displayed.
steps.instruction: Type any URL. (www.google.com)

objects.description:
It should be possible to load a website via 2G-EDGE and 3G data, thus verifying that the connection works.

Prerequisite:
Have the WiFi turned off.
objects.name: [BROWSER] Verify the user can load a website via Cellular Data.

steps.expected: Cellular and Data settings are displayed
steps.instruction: Launch Settings.  Select "Cellular & Data".

steps.expected: Select "Turn ON" in both the messages that appear, for Data Connection and Data Roaming.
steps.instruction: Enable Data Connection and Data Roaming.

steps.expected: The device will be using a 2G-EDGE connection.
steps.instruction: Go to a location which uses the 2G-EDGE connection

steps.expected: The browser app will open.
steps.instruction: Open the browser app.

steps.expected: The correct website will be loaded.
steps.instruction: Tap on the url and type any url.(www.google.com)

steps.expected: The device will be using a 3G data connection.
steps.instruction: Go to a location where the phone uses the 3G connection.

steps.expected: The browser app will open.
steps.instruction: Open the browser app.

steps.expected: The correct website will be loaded.
steps.instruction: Tap on the url and type any url.(www.google.com)

objects.description: It should be possible to select Power off/ Turn on airplane mode/ Restart/ Silence incoming calls.
objects.name: [SYSTEM] Verify Power Button long press menu

steps.expected: "Reboot" menu appears with the following items: "Turn on Airplane mode", "silence incoming calls", "restart", "power off".
steps.instruction: Hold down the power button while holding the phone in portrait mode.

steps.expected: Device shuts down and plays the power down animation.
steps.instruction: Select "Power off"while holding the phone in portrait mode.

objects.description: It should be possible to launch the marketplace.
objects.name: [MARKETPLACE] Marketplace - launch market

steps.expected: The marketplace application should start up and the log in page should load.
steps.instruction: Launch the marketplace app from the home screen.

objects.description: When a hosted web app is installed from marketplace with a valid icon, then app is on the home screen.
objects.name: [MARKETPLACE] Marketplace - Verify the user can install market installed hosted app.

steps.instruction: Open the Marketplace app.

steps.expected: A prompt should appear asking if you would like to install this web application from the origin of that web application. The prompt should specify the origin of the app, the size of the app to be installed, the developer of the app, and the name of the app.
steps.instruction: Find a hosted app to install on marketplace.
Select to install the hosted application.

steps.expected: The prompt should dismiss. The web application should be installed to the homescreen with a valid app icon.
steps.instruction: Confirm that you want to install the web application.

objects.description:
Launch a Web App from the home screen, the web app should start up with the content at the launch_path off of the app origin.

Prerequisite: 
Have a internet connection.
objects.name: [HOMESCREEN] Marketplace - Verify the user can launch market installed hosted apps.

steps.expected: The marketplace will be opened.
steps.instruction: Open the Marketplace app.

steps.expected: The app will be added to the home screen.
steps.instruction: Select and install an app.

steps.expected: The user will be brought back to the home screen.
steps.instruction: Press the home button.
Navigate to the installed app.

steps.expected: The web app should start up and take focus on the device. The content will load the URL equivalent to the origin + launch_path of the application.
steps.instruction: Tap on the installed app.

objects.description:
Uninstall a web application previously installed, App should be removed from the system entirely.

Prerequisite: A hosted web application is already installed in the system.
objects.name: [HOMESCREEN] Marketplace - delete market installed hosted web app

steps.expected: The home screen should being to shake. The app icon should not disappear.
steps.instruction: On the home screen, hard press the web application.

steps.expected: A prompt should appear asking the user if they are sure they want to delete this web app.
steps.instruction: Select the X button on the installed web application.

steps.expected: The app should be removed from the system entirely. This includes removed from the home screen and not running in background (check the card view for this).
steps.instruction: Confirm that you want to uninstall the web application.

objects.description: Settings launch
objects.name: Test that [SETTINGS] Settings can be launched

steps.expected: Then verify that settings can be launched and does not crash
steps.instruction: When 1. tap on Settings

Then 1. Airplane Mode is off
2. GPS is turned on

4. Cellular & Data is turned off
5. Bluetooth is disabled

When 1. tap on Settings
2. scroll through the settings

Then Network & Connectivity
- Airplane Mode
- GPS

- Cellular & Data

Personalization

steps.expected:
Then - Airplane Mode
- GPS
- Wi-Fi
- Cellular & Data
- Bluetooth
- HotSpot
steps.instruction:
When 1. go to settings
2. Make sure Network & Connectivity section is visible.

objects.description:
As a user I want the ability to toggle Airplane Mode ON in the Settings menu so that I can disable wireless signals from the phone.

Prerequisites: 
#a. Airplane mode must be set to disabled.
#b. Wifi must be connected and active.
#c. GPS is enabled.
#d. Data Connection under the Cellular & Data category must be enabled.
objects.name: [SETTINGS] When you turn Airplane mode on: Wifi, GPS and Cellular Data are turned off

steps.expected: Verify that you see Airplane mode with an option to enable/disable this option.
steps.instruction: Launch Settings and navigate to the Network & Connectivity section.

steps.expected: Airplane mode option will get a check mark to indicate this option is active.
steps.instruction: Tap Airplane mode to On.

steps.expected: Verify that GPS, Wifi and Cellular and Data options are switched off once Airplane mode is enabled.
steps.instruction: Observe the GPS, Wifi and Cellular & Data options.

objects.description:
As a user I want the ability to toggle Airplane Mode OFF in the Settings menu so that I can re-enable wireless signals from the phone.

Prerequisites:
#a. Wifi must have been connected and active when Airplane mode was enabled.
#b. GPS was enabled before Airplane mode was enabled.
#c. Data Connection under the Cellular & Data category must have been enabled before Airplane mode was enabled.
#d. Airplane mode must be set to enabled.
objects.name: [SETTINGS] When you turn Airplane mode off: Wifi, GPS and Cellular Data are turned back on

steps.expected: Verify that you see Airplane mode with an option to enable/disable this option.
steps.instruction: Launch Settings and navigate to the Network & Connectivity section.

steps.expected: Airplane mode option will lose the check mark which will indicate that this option is disabled.
steps.instruction: Tap to disable Airplane mode.

steps.expected: Verify that GPS, Wifi and Cellular and Data options are re-enabled once Airplane mode is disabled.
steps.instruction: Observe the GPS, Wifi and Cellular & Data options.

objects.description: GPS on check.
objects.name: [SETTINGS] Turn GPS on, Geolocation will find you.

steps.expected: GPS is enabled.
steps.instruction: Select the settings menu, turn GPS on, and hit the home button.

steps.expected: Web browser opens up.
steps.instruction: Launch the web browser.

steps.expected:
1. Geolocation dialog should appear; click Allow.
2. Geolocation icon in the status bar should appear.
3. http://m.here.net/ should be able to determine the location.
steps.instruction: Go to http://m.here.net/

objects.description: GPS off check.
objects.name: [SETTINGS] Turn GPS off, Geolocation cannot find you.

steps.expected: GPS is disabled, and return to home screen.
steps.instruction: Go to the Settings menu from the home screen, turn GPS off, and hit home button.

steps.expected: Browser is opened.
steps.instruction: Launch the web browser.

steps.expected:
1. Geolocation dialog should appear; click Allow; it should not appear at all.
2. Geolocation icon in the status bar should not appear.
3. http://m.here.net/ should not be able to determine the location.
steps.instruction: Go to http://m.here.net/

Cellular & Data Multiple SIMs

1. SIM picker will show and multiple carriers in subtitle if there is more than 1 SIM card.

objects.description:
While viewing the Settings - Cellular & Data menu, the following sections must be displayed: Carrier Name, Data Connection, Data Roaming, Network Operator, Data Settings, A-GPS Settings

#Pre-Requisites: Have a working SIM card inserted into the device
objects.name: [SETTINGS] Checking the content of the Cellular & Data section in settings

steps.instruction: Go to settings

steps.expected:
Then - Carrier
- Carrier name in subtitle
- Data Connection on/off
- Data Roaming on/off
Advanced Settings
-Network Operator
- APN Settings
steps.instruction: Select Cellular & Data

steps.expected:
Data settings
Messages settings 
A-GPS settings
Tethering settings 
IMS settings
steps.instruction: Tap APN Settings

objects.description: Cellular & Data Data Connection
objects.name: Test that [SETTINGS] Cellular & Data Data Connection

steps.instruction: Go to settings and select Cellular & Data
Select Data Connection
Go back to the main settings and go to wifi
Turn wifi off and select the home button.

steps.expected: Verify that you can go to www.google.com on cellular data
steps.instruction: Launch browser and go to www.google.com

objects.description: Cellular & Data - Roaming
objects.name: Test that [SETTINGS] Cellular & Data - Roaming

steps.instruction: Go to settings and select Cellular & Data
Make sure Data Connection is not turned on and go back to the main settings
Go to wifi and turn wifi off then hit the home button.

steps.expected: Verify that you cannot go to www.google.com
steps.instruction: Launch browser and go to www.google.com

objects.description:
Verify the device has no data connection when using a SIM from another state/country with WiFi and Data Roaming turned off.
Pre-Requisites: Have a SIM card that is from out of state or country
objects.name: Test that [SETTINGS] Cellular & Data -No Roaming

steps.instruction: Insert a SIM card from out of the state or country>Power on the device
Go to Settings>Cellular & Data
Turn ON Data Connection
Turn OFF Data Roaming
Go back to main Settings Menu>Select Wi-Fi
Disable Wi-Fi
Press the Home button>Open the Browser App

steps.expected: Verify the user is not brought to the website and there is no symbol in the status bar to designate roaming.
steps.instruction: Attempt to navigate to any website (ex: www.google.com)

objects.description:
Verify the device is able to use data connection through Roaming when using a SIM from another state/Country with WiFi off and Data Roaming turned on. 
#Pre-Requisites: Have a SIM card that is from out of the state or country
objects.name: Test that [SETTINGS] Cellular & Data - Data Connection with roaming

steps.instruction: Insert a SIM card from out of the state or country>Power on the device
Go to Settings>Cellular & Data
Turn ON Data Connection
Turn ON Data Roaming
Go back to main Settings Menu>Select Wi-Fi
Disable Wi-Fi
Press the Home button>Open the Browser App

steps.expected: Verify the user is brought to the website and there is a symbol in the status bar designating Roaming is in process
steps.instruction: Attempt to navigate to any website (ex: www.google.com)

objects.description: As a user when "Add APN" has failed I want to be informed "Unable to find the Access Point. Check that the following information is correct" along with the password field cleared, so that I may verify the information necessary to establish an Access Point.
objects.name: Test that [SETTINGS] Cellular & Data - APN Settings Incorrect Info

steps.expected: "Unable to find the Access Point. Check that the following information is correct" along with the password field cleared.
steps.instruction:
When 1. go to settings
2. select Cellular & Data
3. select APN settings
4. type in incorrect information

objects.description:
Cellular & Data APN Settings - correct info; Note: test at a coffee shop

As a user, I want to see a confirmation message with the name of the Access Point that was successfully added, so that I am aware of a successful connection.
objects.name: Test that [SETTINGS] Cellular & Data - APN Settings Correct Info

steps.expected: Then verify that you get connected to the access point (you get a confirmation message with the name of the Access Point that was successfully added).
steps.instruction:
When 1. go to settings
2. select Cellular & Data
3. select APN settings
4. type in correct information about the access point

objects.description: As a user, when Bluetooth is ON and my phone is paired with multiple devices, I want to see the first paired device's name and a counter showing the number of other devices connected (e.g. "headset, +3 more") displayed as a subheading under "Bluetooth" settings menu item, so that I do not need to tap to know this current status.
objects.name: [SETTINGS] Bluetooth connect with 2 or more devices

steps.expected: The Network & Connectivity section is displayed including the Bluetooth option.
steps.instruction: Go to settings.

steps.expected: The Bluetooth on/off switch is set to OFF by default.
steps.instruction: Select Bluetooth.

steps.expected: The Bluetooth is set to ON. And the phone automatically begins searching for devices.
steps.instruction: Activate Bluetooth.

steps.expected: You are able to connect.
steps.instruction: Connect to 2 or more devices.

steps.expected: Then verify that subtitle for Bluetooth states a device +<number> more, where <number> is the number of bluetooth devices connected -1.
steps.instruction: When hit the back button

objects.description: As a user, I want to be able to "Rename My Device" which must allow me to "Change Phone Name" and still be able to be found via Bluetooth and allow pairing with other devices.
objects.name: [SETTINGS] Bluetooth Visible to other devices even when phone is renamed

steps.expected: The Network & Connectivity section is displayed including the Bluetooth option.
steps.instruction: Go to settings.

steps.expected: The Bluetooth on/off switch is set to OFF by default.
steps.instruction: Select Bluetooth.

steps.expected: The Bluetooth is set to ON.
steps.instruction: Activate Bluetooth.

steps.expected: The current device name is selected, and the keyboard is up.
steps.instruction: Tap the "Rename my device"  button in the bluetooth section

steps.expected: The name entered is saved and the view is returned to the Bluetooth settings
steps.instruction: Enter another name for the device and Tap Done.

steps.expected: The phone with the new name can be found via Bluetooth.
steps.instruction: Then on another device or machine, attempt to locate the device with the new name.

objects.description:
As a user, when Bluetooth is ON, I want the options to "Disconnect" and "Unpair" a paired and connected device from my phone, so that I can perform these operations contextually for each device.

Prerequisites: The device must have an active Bluetooth connection.
objects.name: [SETTINGS] Bluetooth connection with a bluetooth device Disconect/Unpair popup

steps.expected: The Network & Connectivity section is displayed including the Bluetooth option.
steps.instruction: Go to Settings.

steps.expected: The Bluetooth on/off switch is set to OFF by default.
steps.instruction: Select Bluetooth.

steps.expected: The Bluetooth is set to ON.
steps.instruction: Activate Bluetooth.

steps.expected: There is minimum a device connected as in prerequisites.
steps.instruction: Check the "Paired Devices" list to see if there are any Bluetooth devices connected.

steps.expected:
A  popup dialog appears that contains the sections:

- Disconnect

- Unpair
steps.instruction: Long tap on the device that is connected.

objects.description: As a user, I want to be able to tap or long-press any item in the Paired Devices list which provides me the menu option to Unpair, so that I may unpair my phone from the chosen paired device.
objects.name: [SETTINGS] Disconnecting a bluetooth connection between two devices.

steps.instruction: Launch Settings.

steps.expected: Verify the user is taken to a new screen with Bluetooth options.
steps.instruction: Tap on Bluetooth.

steps.expected: Verify that there is a disconnect between the bluetooth device and the subtitle for the device states Tap to connect.
steps.instruction: Check the list to see if there are any bluetooth devices connected, if there is a device connected, long tap on the device that is connected and select disconnect.
